com.peterson.markovchain

    • Method Detail

      • addPhrase

        void addPhrase(java.lang.String phrase)
        Add a single phrase to the database. This will generate with previous chains with the chain resulting from the passed phrase. The words of the phrase generate with the assumption that each word is separated by a space, and if the sentence does not contain a period at the end, it will be appended with one.
        Parameters:
        phrase - the sentence to add to the chain.

      • generateSentence

        java.lang.String generateSentence()
        Generate a random sentence using the chains in the database. This is the default behaviour of a markov chain; it starts off with the first element in the chain and forms based off of that. Calls to this method remove no data from the chain database.
        Returns:
        a single generated sentence.

      • generateSentence

        java.lang.String generateSentence(java.lang.String seed)
        Generates a Markov phrase based off a seed word. Similar to generateSentence(), this will generate a phrase using the supplied seed word as a start state. If, for some reason, the word is not in the database, this will return NO_CHAIN, signaling that a chain could not be formed
        Parameters:
        seed - the seed word to start the chain with
        Returns:
        a generated phrase using the seed word or NO_CHAIN if a chain could not be started
